definition: evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
(Buddhism) retribution/karma
the time has not yet come
retribution
appropriate retribution (idiom)
persisting in evil brings about self-destruction (idiom)
pinyin: duo1 xing2 bu4 yi4 bi4 zi4 bi4

definition: retribution/judgment
lay down butcher's knife, become a Buddha on the spot (idiom); instant rehabilitation/to repent and be absolved of one's crimes
pinyin: fang4 xia4 tu2 dao1 , li4 di4 cheng2 fo2

definition: lit. heaven's net has wide meshes, but nothing escapes it (idiom, from Laozi 73)/fig. the way of Heaven is fair, but the guilty will not escape/you can't run from the long arm of the law
pinyin: tian1 wang3 hui1 hui1 , shu1 er2 bu4 lou4

definition: Look out for yourself, or heaven and earth will combine to destroy you./Every man for himself, and the Devil take the hindmost.
pinyin: ren2 bu4 wei4 ji3 , tian1 zhu1 di4 mie4

definition: lit. Sow melon and you get melon, sow beans and you get beans (idiom); fig. As you sow, so shall you reap./One must live with the consequences of one's actions./You've made your bed, now must lie on it.
pinyin: zhong4 gua1 de2 gua1 , zhong4 dou4 de2 dou4

definition: karmic retribution within one's lifetime
if revenge breeds revenge, will there ever be an end to it? (Buddhist saying)
pinyin: yuan1 yuan1 xiang1 bao4 he2 shi2 liao3

definition: to do good works/to be merciful
karma/cause and effect
